metadata.title: CVE-2023-52887 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: can: j1939: enhanced error handling for tightly received RTS messagesin xtp_rx_rts_session_newThis patch enhances error handling in scenarios with RTS (Request toSend) messages arriving closely. It replaces the less informativeWARN_ON_ONCEbacktraces with a new error handling method. This provides clearer errormessages and allows for the early termination of problematic sessions.Previously, sessions were only released at the end of j1939_xtp_rx_rts().Potentially this could be reproduced with something like:testj1939 -r vcan0:0x80 &while true; do	# send first RTS	cansend vcan0 18EC8090#1014000303002301;	# send second RTS	cansend vcan0 18EC8090#1014000303002301;	# send abort	cansend vcan0 18EC8090#ff00000000002301;done

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-48-generic - 6.8.0-48.48
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-48-generic - 6.8.0-48.48
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-48-generic-64k - 6.8.0-48.48
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1018-aws - 6.8.0-1018.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1017-azure - 6.8.0-1017.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1017-gcp - 6.8.0-1017.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1015-ibm - 6.8.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1015-oracle - 6.8.0-1015.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1015-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1015.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1016-oem - 6.8.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1014.21
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-48.48').
linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1018.20').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1017.20').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1017.19').
linux-gke package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-1013.17').
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1015.15').
linux-lowlatency package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-48.48.3').
linux-oracle package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1015.16').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1016.16').
linux-raspi package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-1014.16').
linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1014.21').
linux-raspi-realtime package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-2013.14').
linux-realtime package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.1-1011.11').
